definition: variant of 迴響|回响[hui2 xiang3]
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: During the break, the sportsground rang with happy shouts.
sentences.chinese: 課間休息時，操場上回響着歡快的叫聲。

sentences.english: The word freedom echoes down the corridors of Freedom.
sentences.chinese: 在《自由》一書中各處都回響着“自由”一詞。

sentences.english: Langdon could hear his own footsteps reverberating off the glass overhead.
sentences.chinese: 蘭登能聽到他自己的腳步聲在頭頂的玻璃上回響。

sentences.english: The hill (echoed) back the noise of the gun-shot.
sentences.chinese: 山上回響着嘈雜的槍聲。

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
to affect/to produce a change in sth
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
to turn a blind eye to
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
